After the House passed my bill to #EndForcedArbitration, the Senate acted swiftly and got it across the finish line this morning.

Soon, the legislation will become law and sexual assault and harassment survivors will no longer be muzzled by hidden legal fine print. https://t.co/2YPYES0a8U

I‚Äôm so grateful to @RepMGriffith, @RepJayapal, @RepKenBuck, @SenGillibrand, @LindseyGrahamSC and @GretchenCarlson for their help getting this over the finish line.¬†

Excited for our bill to reach @POTUS Biden‚Äôs desk!

This week, my bill passed the House floor with 113 Republicans voting for the bill. With this bipartisan support, Leader @SenSchumer and @SenatorDurbin got the bill on the Senate floor today where it passed UNANIMOUSLY!

I reintroduced the bill in the 116th and 117th Congress, and in 2021, it finally received a hearing in @JudiciaryDems and @HouseJudiciary! During these hearings, victims testified about their experiences with forced arbitration and workplace sexual assault and harassment.

As we worked to rally support for the bill, 56 Attorneys General from all 50 states, territories and D.C. called for its passage in 2018.¬†

Soon, tech giants, like Microsoft and Uber, took action and removed forced arbitration clauses buried in their employment documents.

I knew right away that we needed to put a stop to this insidious practice. After working with my team to craft legislation, we first introduced the Ending Forced Arbitration of Sexual Harassment Act in December 2017!

In 2017, I read a @washingtonpost story about the culture of sexual assault & harassment at Sterling, Inc. and how victims were barred from seeking justice in court due to forced arbitration agreements hidden in their employment paperwork.

https://t.co/zZL7SwB7CH

Today, the Senate passed my bill to #EndForcedArbitration for sexual harassment and assault. 

This is a HUGE step forward to making this law, but it‚Äôs been a long road to get here. Check out some of the stops we‚Äôve made along the way: üßµ

BREAKING: The U.S. Senate has officially passed my bill, the Ending Forced Arbitration of Sexual Assault & Sexual Harassment Act!

Survivors will soon be able to seek justice in the courtroom, once this bill becomes law. Next stop, @POTUS Biden‚Äôs desk. #EndForcedArbitration

NEWS: This morning, the U.S. Senate will vote to pass my bill to #EndForcedArbitration!

From when I first introduced the bill until today, it's been a long road, but I'm thrilled to see it take this last step before it's sent to the President‚Äôs desk to become law! https://t.co/qh8gX7lKk3
